p: In China, infectious diarrhea (excluding cholera, dysentery, typhoid and paratyphoid) is an intestinal infectious disease with diarrhea and/or vomiting as the main symptom. It has been listed as a legal Class C infectious disease [ 3]. An infectious diarrhea case, clinically diagnosed or etiologically confirmed by any hospital or healthcare institution throughout the country, must be reported timely and directly to the National Notifiable Disease Surveillance System (NNDSS) [ 15] ( http://www.cdpc.chinacdc.cn).
